column3: At 8:40 A.M. she was wheeled out on a stretcher headed for Mayo General Hospital, blistered and burned by a tanning bed turned torture chamber.

At this moment the clock indicated 8.40. "Five minutes more," said Andrew Stuart. The five friends looked at each other. One may surmise that their heart-beats were slightly accelerated, for, even for bold gamblers, the stake was a large one.

It was when I stood before her, avoiding her eyes, that I took note of the surrounding objects in detail, and saw that her watch had stopped at twenty minutes to nine, and that a clock in the room had stopped at twenty minutes to nine.
